official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude
		  from gross income certain State foster care program payments made to the
		  biological parents of disabled children.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Exclusion from gross income
			 of certain State foster care program payments made to biological parents of
			 disabled children

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the
			 end the following new paragraph:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Subsection (c) of
			 section 131 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
solely because the qualified
				foster individual with respect to which such payment is made is the biological
				child of the foster care
				provider.

text.#text:
A payment made
				pursuant to a foster care program of a State or political subdivision thereof
				shall not fail to be treated as a difficulty of care payment which is
				excludible from gross income under

header.#text:
Application to
				biological parents receiving payments through State foster care
				programs

text.#text:
The amendment made by this section shall apply to payments
			 made in taxable years ending after the date of the enactment of this
			 Act.
